summary: This document is a Federal Bureau of Prisons chain of custody log for evidence recovered from the cell of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 12, 2019. It details the collection of personal items, medications, and correspondence from his cell location, 9 South 206-220, following his death.

persons.name: Epstein, Jeffery
persons.context: The inmate from whose cell (9 South 206-220) the listed evidence items were recovered. Listed as the suspect associated with the evidence.

events.title: Evidence Recovery from Epstein's Cell
events.description: Bureau of Prisons personnel recovered multiple items of evidence from inmate Jeffrey Epstein's cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, location 9 South 206-220.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (inferred from context and MCC designation)
9 South 206-220 - LAD (specific cell location within MCC)
keyFacts: Evidence was collected from Jeffrey Epstein's prison cell on August 12, 2019, the day after his death.
The recovered items included personal effects (glasses, bible, headphones), medications (pain relief, methylprednisolone, milk of magnesia), and correspondence (letter mail, envelope).
One item was described as a 'brown paper bag with writing "SW U2 dinner"', which may indicate social connections or events.
All evidence was marked to be held and was released to the SIS (Special Investigative Services) Office on the same day for further analysis.
